definition:
Let $L$ be an algebraic extension of a field $K$, and let
$\alpha_1\in L$ be algebraic over $K$. Then $\alpha_1$ is the root of a
minimal polynomial $f(x)\in K[x]$. Denote the other roots of $f(x)$ in
$L$ by $\alpha_2$, $\alpha_3, \ldots, \alpha_n$. These (along with
$\alpha_1$ itself) are the *algebraic conjugates* of $\alpha_1$ and any
two are said to be *algebraically conjugate*.

The notion of algebraic conjugacy is a special case of group conjugacy
in the case where the group in question is the Galois group of the above
minimal polynomial, viewed as acting on the roots of said polynomial.
